intro: Dalechampia serrula, commonly known as the serrulate dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often serrated or toothed. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or green, surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Dalechampia serrula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
